briefTitle: Does a Non-Opioid Multimodal Pain (NOMO) Protocol Decrease Narcotic Use

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* English-speaking females
* greater than or equal to 18 years old
* scheduled for a urogynecologic procedure at GHS requiring inpatient stay or extended observation.

Exclusion Criteria:

* less than 18 years of age
* non-English speaking patients
* unscheduled urogynecologic surgeries
* patients expected to undergo a simple reconstructive surgery with same-day discharge,
* history of chronic pain
* chronic Lyrica or Celebrex use
* psychiatric disorder, narcotic dependence or narcotic prescription in the past six weeks
* current liver disease
* kidney disease (defined as GFR \<60)
* malignancy
* sulfa allergy

outcomeMeasures.title: Morphine Milligram Equivalents Used During Inpatient Stay
outcomeMeasures.description: Total morphine milligram equivalents calculated for each patient during their stay.

outcomeMeasures.title: Passage of Voiding Trial
outcomeMeasures.description: percentage of patients who pass voiding trial on POD#1

outcomeMeasures.title: Anti-emetic Use
outcomeMeasures.description: Did the patient require anti-emetics in the post-operative period

outcomeMeasures.title: Patient Pain Score
outcomeMeasures.description: Evaluated via the "Brief Pain Inventory (Short Form)"; rate pain on scale 0-10, 10 being worst

outcomeMeasures.title: Prescription for Opioid at Discharge
outcomeMeasures.description: Did the patient require a narcotic prescription

outcomeMeasures.title: Length of Hospital Stay
outcomeMeasures.description: The average number of days patients were admitted as inpatient.
